item.title: Reservoir Shop
item.body: A new ?concept store? full of clothes, shoes, magazines and old discs. Warmly recommended by enthusiasts of arty, trendy fashion!

item.title: Z'Art
item.body: "Comic design" is the best descriptor for this treasure-house of decorative knickknacks and playful accessories, all designed for sheer fun. Z'art distributes Pylones products, a range of designer utensils and gadgets intended to keep life on the lighter side. Online shopping also available.

item.title: Espace BD
item.body: Strip cartoon bookshop / gallery of originals. Gallery of silk-screen prints. Publication of strip cartoon-related products.

item.title: La Bande des Six Nez
item.body: Strip cartoons of every kind! Permanent gallery of silk-screen prints, lithography,... New and second hand comic strips.

item.title: The Cantillon Brewery
item.body: Created in 1900, this family-run brewery produces Gueuze, Kriek, Faro and Lambic beers. The last brewery in Brussels still operating, the business is open to the public, runs guided tours and organises folk brewing sessions twice a year.

item.title: Sterling Books
item.body: English Librairy

item.title: New Dewolf
item.body: Bric-a-brac with an arty touch. At New Dewolf you can find a bit of everything - from ornaments and sofas to Christmas garlands and chandeliers. Ali-Baba?s cave spread over more than 2,000 square metres!

item.title: Oxfam - Magasins du Monde
item.body: A pair of shoes, a dress, a bag or an ornament: all Oxfam articles come from Fair Trade commerce.

item.title: Bellerose
item.body: This top international chain offers modern, urban fashion for everybody.

item.title: Hunting and Collecting
item.body: Select store of 300 square meters. "We want to mix fashion and art to offer a global concept, a real way of living with clothes (men, women, children), accessories, music, books, deco, shoes, ... Our selection is always living with more of 30 exclusives brands who have 2 common things : great quality and its own universe.

item.title: Gabriele Vintage
item.body: Gabriele Vintage is a specialised « vintage » boutique, for men and women.

item.title: Olivier Strelli
item.body:
Top-of-the-range ready-to-wear clothes for men and women.
Called ?The Belgian? on international catwalks, Strelli is one of the fi rst stylists to have conquered the world.

item.title: Atelier Christophe Coppens
item.body: Welcome to the world of Christophe Coppens, the Belgian king of hats and high fashion accessories.
item.address: Place du Nouveau Marché aux Grains 23/Nieuwe Graanmarkt 23

item.title: Own Shop
item.body: Located in a listed Art Nouveau building, and was designed by architects Lhoas & Lhoas. It offers a selection of women and men's clothing and accessories by cult Parisien label A.P.C., and the up and coming Swedish brand, ACNE. You can also find IL BUSETTO leather from Florence, and other brands like FIFTH AVENUE SHOE REPAIR, STEPHANIE SCHNEIDER/17 et ALTADENA WORKS

item.title: Y-dress ?
item.body: Aleksandra Pazkowska casts a different glance at fashion by proposing designs that are beautiful, playful, simple and that cultivate the art of turning clothes upside-down and inside-out: convert your skirt into a party dress, your t-shirt into a pair of trousers or your towel into a beach dress.

item.title: Les Précieuses
item.body: Realization of collars. One also finds there socks, scarves and gloves of Antipast as well as the famous Dyptiques candles

item.title: Christophe Coppens
item.body: Atypical modiste and exceptionally gifted creator, Christophe Coppens caps the Mathilde princess as well as the Belgian gentry or the young Frenchwomen of passage! In parallel of its pretty shop where poetic hats and objects of house design are neighbourly, it created a space in an old banana warehouse where one can follow the manufacture of his creations.

item.title: Whazup
item.body:
The home for unusual products! High-tech, decorative items, geeky gadgets, Whazup select a whole bunch of innovative, design objects, sometimes odd, sometimes funny, always likely to generate entertainment, wonderment and? enthusiasm! To find THE unexpected gift!
You?ll even find alarms that ring, jump and run away, remote-controlled helico of triode connected to your multimedia material.

item.title: Bozar Shop
item.body:
Concentrated culture, in the widest sense of the word. The shop in the Museum of Fine Arts has a vast choice of books, posters, gadgets, CD?s, DVD?s and magazines.
A real Ali Baba?s cave, open late during concert evenings.

item.title: La Boîte à Musique
item.body: Great collection of classical music.

item.title: Neuhaus
item.body:
Jean Neuhaus invented the famous "praline" in 1912.
Neuhaus is a Belgian Royal Warrant Holder.

item.title: Delvaux
item.body: Absolutely the place to go for leather goods! Since 1829 Delvaux has been a symbol of know-how and tradition. Apart from bags, you can find a wide range of small leather goods, scarves, shawls and gloves. A mix of tradition and contemporary creativity.

item.title: Plaizier
item.body: « Plaizier », that?s the pleasure of leafing through and collecting a series of original postcards with a nice retro look or the pleasure of decorating your walls with various movie posters of the fifties.

item.title: Tropismes Libraires
item.body:
This bookshop is internationally renowned, especially for literature, human science and fine arts. Adutls are welcomed in the Prince's Gallery; children in the King's Gallery.
This bookshop is internationally renowned, especially for literature, human science and fine arts. Adults are welcomed in the Prince?s Gallery; children in the King?s Gallery.

item.title: Tropismes (l'appartement)
item.body: This bookshop for children (for adults in the Prince?s Gallery) is internationally renowned.

item.title: Galerie Bortier
item.body: Here you are guided through the gallery by the smell of old books before coming across the B-Gallery which features the work of some of Brussels' youngest artists, many of them exposing for the first time. If you like bargain hunting, take a literary pause in this calm and quiet gallery.

item.title: La boutique Tintin
item.body: No need to say more: all Hergé?s works are here. A lovely shop with lovely objects that are now quite rare.

item.title: Evasions
item.body: General bookstore.

item.title: Multi Jeunesse
item.body: Its name says it all (Multi Youth): a wide choice of books, toys and games for old and young alike. Right next to its sister shop, Multi BD.

item.title: Lady Paname
item.body: No need to fasten your raincoat and lower your head when you enter this sex shop. Lady Paname is the chicest porno boutique around. Sex toys, lubricants, underwear and all sorts of ointments are on display?

item.title: Herboristerie Moderne
item.body: (not available) Une gamme de plantes aromatiques et d'épices pour la santé, la cuisine, la cosmétique mais surtout pour le plaisir.

item.title: Le Fabuleux Marcel de Bruxelles
item.body: On top making lemeilleur marcel in the universe, Marcel is now a lot more than marcels. We like to look at fashion in another way. D'accord, that sounds a bit cheesy and ridicule, but we don't really see ourselves as a fashion brand. We just enjoy making cool clothes premium quality toujours with a lot of nostalgie. We got our inspiration from ou parent's or grandparent's old clothes and added a touch of today.

item.title: Super Dragon Toys
item.body: For fans of mangas and figurines from the land of the rising sun, this hub of Japanese culture sells books and all sorts of gadgets.

item.title: Van Dael
item.body: Coffee roasting. Wide choice of tea. Wines. Coffeepots/theapots.

item.title: Mich' Van Dijk Boutique
item.body: Brands: Chacok, Save the Queen, Mariella Burani, Bleu Blanc Rouge, Indies, JC Trigon, Van RYB.

item.title: Mireille van den Borne
item.body: The house "van den Borne" takes her wellknown place by the elegance and the quality of her creativity. Created in 1935, this house makes exclusive hats, handmade and according with your desires, what the color and the shape concern.

item.title: Pin'Art - Antiques
item.body: The passion of India and authentic English and Portuguese colonial furniture. Chinese furniture, shimmering fabrics, original jewellery, purchases that will make your heart skip a beat.

item.title: Ozfair
item.body: Devoted to natural products and fair trading, this establishment operates along three main lines: the sale of items that are organic or sourced from the solidarity economy, the sampling of the daily specials, breakfasts and takeaway dishes, and making consumers aware of sustainable themes.

item.title: Aurora
item.body: Second hand books

item.title: Casse Noisettes
item.body: Welcome to toy kingdom, for small and large children. Treasures include traditional wooden toys, disguises, construction models and passionate adult society games.

item.title: Dolma - natural shop
item.body: One of the oldest natural- and organic-food shops in Belgium's capital city, Dolma sells fresh fruits and vegetables, gluten- and lactose-free products, natural food supplements, organic breads, organic and natural wines, and takeaway cuisine. A wide selection of books on Tibetan Buddhism, naturopathic medicine, aromatherapy and diets complements a stock entirely dedicated to well-being. Dishes to take away.

item.title: La Tonnelle des Délices
item.body: Delicatessen offering sweet and savoury flavours from various sources including: Upignac, Fauchon, Dandoy, Terre exotique, Belberry, Valrhona. Gift baskets and cooking lessons.

item.title: Guitarreria
item.body: Not just any commercial shop but an association of professionals and well-informed enthusiasts sharing the same keen interest in the flamenco guitar and classical guitar. In the light of their extensive travelling and discoveries they are anxious to bring less well known luthiers in to the public eye, convinced their work is really a must-see experience. Specifically focused on fine quality guitars, their business is to offer instruments selected with utmost care.

item.title: Gesso
item.body: Gesso manufactures mouldings, columns, wall lamps and other ornaments in plasters, but also restores old ceilings or creates new items in plasters on-measures.

item.title: Luxiol
item.body: For twenty years now, likeable proprietor Marc Jaumaux has been collecting and offering a full range of wooden toys, Chinese puzzles, strategy and board games for all ages. Mobiles, rocking-horses, tricycles, juggling equipment and music boxes all contribute to an atmosphere of childhood regained. A superb range of silver jewellery, accessories and decorative items also help make Luxiol the ideal gift shop!

item.title: Le Jardin d'Apollon
item.body: The place to go to for bonsai, Le Jardin d?Apollon sells not only a wide range of species, but also all you need to ensure they live and grow in harmony. After all, bonsai are inseparable from interior decorating, feng shui, statues of Buddha and wooden artefacts. However, what makes this shop special is the advice and service supplied by its owner, a true aficionado, who will even take care of your bonsai while you are away or if it falls sick.

item.title: Renard
item.body: Bakery - Pâtisserie

item.title: Beer Mania
item.body: Beer Mania suggest you more than 400 traditional belgian beers. Also concert of jazz.

item.title: Pax
item.body: This place is one of the trendiest shops in Brussels. The clothing is original, with prices to match. Has also vintage decoration items.

item.title: Look 50
item.body: Second-hand clothes shop with a vintage style. You?ll find all the accessories, clothes and shoes you need for a retro look. You just have to rummage around a bit!

item.title: Kusje
item.body: The place to shop for girls? clothes. Lots of original colours and designs, side-by-side with the latest brands.

item.title: Les Choux Verts
item.body:
A bit of nature for mum and baby. Organic clothes, bedding, washable nappies and more.
Clothes for babies from 0 to 4 years.

item.title: Sol Luna
item.body: Silver jewellery, clothes and items from Asia.

item.title: Bjouterie Pavo
item.body: Jewels and accessories design.

item.title: Demeuldre
item.body: List of wedding, porcelain, crystal, silversmithing.

item.title: Une Longue Histoire
item.body: Objects in wood and "Must-have" items at more than reasonable prices. We invite you to come and discover a wide range of items, mainly from Indonesia, India and Africa.

item.title: Atelier Flores
item.body: Creation and restoration of glass, windows, Tiffany, etc.

item.title: Eldorado
item.body: Renting of costumes for theater, cinema, carnival, advertisaing, events, role play, retro fashion, disco, science fiction,... Renting of regional and international costumes. Renting of clothes for historical reconstruction. Renting of costumes for kids.

item.title: Piano Maene
item.body: 70 years of experience Selective and exclusive range of piano brands Specialisation and expert knowledge in the field of transportation, tuning, maintenance and restoration Professional advice by our piano consultants Complementary team of forty employees Specialisation on each part of a piano Tailor-made service by providing all possible purchase, leasing and renting systems Maene financing A renowned workshop Historic museum with Chris Maene's private collection Specialised concert leasing with an exclusive Steinway-fleet of instruments Three branches in Ruiselede, Ghent and Brussels Two concert halls in our shops in Ruiselede and Brussels Pleasant, atmospheric surrounding Easy accessible Opened all year round

item.title: La Forêt Noire
item.body:
Traditionnal baker shop - pastry shop;
For the sake of taste! Quality at is best, at our counter or to order.

item.title: Vandenhende
item.body: Founded by an ice cream maker and a confectioner, the shop is renowned for the originality of its recipes, which are based on customers? requirements. In addition to this work on ?made-to-measure? chocolate, Vendenhende has a certain reputation for its chocolate fondant.

item.title: Luc Genot
item.body: Large selection of beaded necklaces and semi-precious stones. Graduated from the University of Nantes in Gemology. Expertise, repair and manufacture. Fellow of the Gemmological Association of Great Britain.

item.title: Frantz Hemeleers Antiquités
item.body: In 1975, Frantz Hemeleers opens a small 80m² Antique Shop on avenue des Casernes (between bd Général Jacques and La Chasse) in Etterbeek district. Throughout the years Frantz Hemeleers expands his business and becomes an enthusiastic antique dealer and collector. Moreover, he widens the range of furniture, ornaments and collecting pieces; sometimes coming from England, France, Sweden and Belgium. Subsequently, Frantz Hemeleers continues his pursuit of Beauty by always looking for objects of higher quality in terms of style, age and value: such as for example, polished items or inlaid furniture with marquetry decoration. At the present time, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop consists of 600m2 and proposes a variety of items as well as some pieces of exceptional quality and rarity dating back to the seventeenth, the eighteenth, the nineteenth and sometimes the twentieth century. The store is very often renewed and each piece of furniture firstly visits Frantz Hemeleers? workshop before being presented to the public. In this shop you will discover a huge selection of furniture such as desks, bookcases, tables, chairs, armchairs, sofas, chests, cabinets, console tables ?as well as a vast range of ornaments, pictures, mirrors, candlesticks, lamps, silverware, bronzes,? In other words, Frantz Hemeleers Antique Shop is an ideal place to find the perfect gift.

item.title: OliWood Toys
item.body: Welcome to the world of games and quality toys. The boutique Oli Wood Toys invites you to open the door. From toys for the little kids to the strategy games for the older, a wide choice will be offered. There is also a range of dolls, puzzles, stuffed animals, creative leisure, figurines, costume, ... and many other surprises. Games and toys usually have a pedagogical or educational value. The aesthetic is involved in our choices and the quality of the object. The tip is also a priority for us. We always try to satisfy you.

item.title: Mary Chocolatier
item.body: From bitter chocolate mousses to sweet mixes of milk chocolate and caramel or manons, you will be able to choose between more than 70 different kinds of chocolates.

item.title: Waterstone's
item.body: This specialist British bookshop offers a vast choice of books and magazines in English.

item.title: Anticyclone des Açores
item.body: For experienced travellers. This bookshop has an impressive collection of guides, maps and books for globe trotters, be they trekking fans or more sedate travellers.

item.title: International Home of Cooking
item.body: The specialist in kitchen accessories, of all types. The store brims with original gift ideas, from small spoons to cook books.

item.title: Desmecht
item.body: Situated in the heart of Brussels, the herbalist Desmecht has been in existence since 1840. The shop sells dried herbs, infusions, nutritional supplements, natural cosmetics, argan oil, sweet almond oil and other natural oils.

item.title: Kausynoe
item.body: A small boutique with clothing, accessories and decoration. The owner works with Belgian brands and the creator Conni Kaminski.

item.title: Dominique Polain
item.body: To make other people happy or, why not, just for yourself. All sorts of hand-made jewellery at all sorts of prices: pearls, stones, silver, fabrics,? an enchanting concentration of glamour.

item.title: Atchoum
item.body: This shop aims to be polyvalent, even though its various types of pearls take up most of the space. You?ll also find clothes, decorative objects and an exhibition area.

item.title: Foxhole
item.body: Real inspiration in the district: a shop dedicated to second-hand clothing for men and women, as well as accessories. This is the ?Vintage Shop? that you can also find in the Dansaert district.

item.title: Modes
item.body: Second-hand clothes that never go out of fashion. Modes boutique specialises in clothing from a bygone age, lace, household linen and accessories. For real enthusiasts.

item.title: C'est quoi ce souk
item.body: Plenty of decoration and gift ideas here. For the home, the garden, or just for the pleasure of original little objects and gadgets. The speciality is Indian furniture.

item.title: Art Shop 73
item.body: If you want to have a frame made, come with your photo of mummy, fido or your favourite postcard. Art Shop 73 will transfer it onto a sheet of pvc in whatever colour you fancy.

item.title: Le Pain Quotidien
item.body:
With beginning of the year 90, Alain Coumont is cook in a great restaurant of Brussels.
For its preparations, this in love a tasty kitchen and authenticates use that ingredients of quality. Only one black spot: it does not manage to find a bread answering its criteria. Qu' with that does not hold. It will manufacture it itself and it will be a leavened bread. L' opening of its workshop of production is quickly followed by inauguration a first store in the street " tendance" of Brussels, Antoine Dansaert.

item.title: Filippa K
item.body: Women's collection, accessories, blouses, dresses, jackets, jeans, knits, outerwear, shoes, skirts, tights, tops, trousers Men's collection, accessories, jackets, jersey, jeans, knits, outerwear, shirts, shoes, trousers

item.title: SuperGreen Me
item.body: Open only since last December, SuperGreenMe is THE eco-bio shop of the Dansaert district. From ecological baby?s nappies to biological cleaning products, everything is green here!

item.title: Icon
item.body: ISABEL MARANT-ALEXANDER WANG-GOLDEN GOOSE-VANESSA BRUNO-THAKOON
item.address: Place du Nouveau Marché aux Grains 5/Nieuwe Graanmarkt 5

item.title: Johanne Riss
item.body: Haute couture for ladies. Will lycra which transforms thin and rounds in sirens. A shop where space dilates without end, a place filled of creative energy.
item.address: Place du Nouveau Marché aux Grains 35/Nieuwe Graanmarkt 35

item.title: Just In Case
item.body: Just in Box is a mark of famous Belgian mode which is sold in a considerable number of countries. The designers Vicky Vinck and Katrien Strijbol. The collection seeks to explore the limits of the former styles of mode in their adding at the same time romantic details and to the mode. The women who carry Just in Box never do not pass unperceived and are often spontaneously congratulated for the choice on their clothes.

item.title: Carine Gilson
item.body: Carine Gilson is one of the rare designers to imagine the lingerie otherwise than as a simple accessory. Being inspired every season on an artistic subject (The Russian ballets, Klimt, the art nouveau, the Art deco which are her favourite periods), she imagines divine fineries and delicate lingerie. The materials are surprising: the magnificent Lyon?s silks, the lightest muslin, the most delicate Chantilly laces, the audacious palettes of colors as well as the remarkable cuts; all craft realisations in a « haute couture » spirit. Divine fineries, bras, breeches, gowns, strings, negligees, kimonos,? every piece is really unique. This kind of product was only possible thanks to the rigour of the manufacturing and production in the workshop in Anderlecht, and by the work of ultra-qualified seamstresses with fairy?s hands. She seduces the most prestigious shops and departments stores from New York to Tokyo, passing through Paris and London.

item.title: Underwear
item.body: Top-of-the-range underwear and bathwear fashions for women/men.

item.title: Kat en muis
item.body: The boutique is small, like its customers, but you?ll find some interesting Belgian creators here like Max & Lola,...

item.title: Plus One?
item.body: You can be pregnant and still stay chic! This boutique is for active, modern, trendy women who are proud of their new figure.

item.title: Passa Porta Bookshop
item.body: Brussel's international house of literature. Passa Porta is a meeting place for lovers of literature as well as those who create literature, a space where the link between Dutch, French and foreign-language literature is reinforced.

item.title: Lucien Cravate
item.body: Vintage shop

item.title: Kartell
item.body: Specialised in plastic design objects, Kartell has developed a personal style, characterized in its quest for transparency, thanks to privileged collaboration with some of the biggest designers, such as Starck, Urquiola, Meda, Citterio, Lissoni...

item.title: Espace Bizarre
item.body: Celebrating design, the boutique Espace Bizarre offers a vast collection of furniture and very finely designed accessories. You can find here trendy brands like Vange, Casamilano, Missoni, Mooi, Moroso, Vlaemsch and B-products. The perfect spot to elegantly decorate your interior.

item.title: Blender01
item.body: At Blender01, you will find clothing, design, electro, jewellery and a lot of other stuff including exclusive objects.

item.title: Rouge
item.body: A real curiosity that won?t disappoint when you look around. You?ll find a mass of gifts and baba-cool objects, though all Chinese.

item.title: Peuples et Continents
item.body: A hot address for travellers. You can find guides, maps and all sorts of books on the civilisations and regions of the world.

item.title: Shop Magritte
item.body: ?This is not a shop? as the artist might have said, but a boutique - a bookshop that continues your experience of the Musée Magritte Museum. You?ll find reference books, cards, posters and more, all signed Magritte.

item.title: Oliviers & Co
item.body: The perfect address if you want to please someone who loves olive oil. Exceptional choice and quality here.

item.title: Galler
item.body:
Passion for chocolate. Pride in perfection. Constant creativity.
Frequently honoured with official recognitions. The most prestigious is undeniably the appointment as "Belgian Royal Warrant Holder", awarded in 1994.

item.title: Corné Port-Royal Chocolatier
item.body: Since 1932, the leitmotiv of this family home is to rhyme with praline and quality craftsmanship. Corné Port-Royal uses raw materials of the highest quality: pure cocoa butter chocolate without substitute vegetable fat, whole milk, Piémont hazelnuts, Faro almonds, dairy butter. All these products are guaranteed to be free from GMO.

item.title: Dandoy
item.body: Sweet and typically Belgian shopping! The Dandoy house, founded in 1829, is one of the most renowned biscuit makers and has 6 shops in Brussels. Try the ?pain à la grecque?, speculoos or macaroons,? amongst others.

item.title: La Maison des Maîtres Chocolatiers Belges
item.body: La Maison des Maîtres Chocolatiers Belges unites 10 master chocolate-makers from all over Belgium, such as Darcis or Gerbaud. Discover their creations, all quality products guaranteed to use pure cocoa butter and perfectly fresh.

item.title: Corica
item.body:
Traditional roasting of coffee. 25 types of freshly roasted coffee sold by weight and to be sampled. Varieties available here include those from Guatemala, Costa Rica, Columbia, Australia and Ethiopia.
Selection of teas: green, black, Russian and English blends.
Has its own coffee lounge.

item.title: Mr Ego
item.body: A store for really original shopping! And the clientele is as heterogeneous as the clothes, shoes and accessories. Live DJ sets add special ambience.

item.title: Peau D'Ane
item.body: This shop is 100% Brussels! You?ll find the latest creations from young designers, unique lines, and original and varied fabrics. Nothing traditional about it; original in every way!

item.title: Balthazar
item.body: Dezeboetiekbestaat al langerdan 25 jaar en biedtconfectiekledingaan van gerenommeerdemerkenzoals Paul Smith, Filippa K, John Smedley, Issa,?

item.title: The English House
item.body: The British style in high-quality clothing, with the ever-fashionable Burberry.

item.title: Vincent
item.body: Specialist of the tie.

item.title: Cora Kemperman
item.body: A Dutch designer, producing simple and original lines. Wide variety of prices, depending on the material.

item.title: Danaqué
item.body: An original clothing boutique for women of all ages. You?ll find 20 different Belgian and foreign brands. Equally original for shoes, with lines from Trippen, El Naturalista, Loint?s and le Roulard.

item.title: Mer du Nord
item.body: A classic belgian brand that never fails to please its fans. A shop for women and girls, in an ambience that smacks of quality, with prices to match.

item.title: Pom D'Api
item.body: It?s the children?s turn now. Children?s shoes to be exact, with more than 250 models, from size 17 to 40. All the savoir-faire of a family business created in 1870.

item.title: Kipling
item.body: Founded in Antwerp in 1987, Kipling has become a worldwide known brand. This leather store offers a range of bags that are effortlessly stylish, colorful and fun as well as practical and durable for even the most active individual. It also offers other accessories such as sunglasses, shoes, jewellery and watches.

item.title: Monsel
item.body: To keep yourself dry or just for the pleasure of wearing it. Monsel is a paradise for umbrellas and hats ? a traditional shop with a vast choice. You?re bound to find what you want.

item.title: Caroline Music
item.body:
This little record dealer has been helping customers in all styles of music, from hip-hop to rock, for more than 15 years.
Concert tickets.

item.title: Rubbrecht
item.body: Lace and favour

item.title: Belgian Art
item.body: Situated at the Grand?Place in the historic city centre of Brussels, Belgian Art shops proposes a large selection of laces and tapestry of a high quality. Belgian Art is keen to make known and to perpetuate the traditions and history of Belgian culture.

item.title: Coutellerie Tilquin
item.body: Since 1860 this Brussels firm has been selling knives and cutting instruments for all sorts of use, and providing some great ideas for luxury gifts. Sharpening, repair and replating service also available.

item.title: La Courte Echelle
item.body: Meubles & accessoires miniatures. Kits & matériel de bricolage. Mille petites trouvailles. Stages adultes et enfants

item.title: Pêle-Mêle
item.body:
Everything is second-hand here. The store buys and sells books, discs and games from all eras and for all ages.
Pêle-Mêle has Brussels? best collection of low-price albums.

item.title: Le Pain Quotidien
item.body:
With beginning of the year 90, Alain Coumont is cook in a great restaurant of Brussels.
For its preparations, this in love a tasty kitchen and authenticates use that ingredients of quality. Only one black spot: it does not manage to find a bread answering its criteria. Qu' with that does not hold. It will manufacture it itself and it will be a leavened bread.
Now, Le Pain Quotidien is a worldwide fashionable chain serving chic sandwiches and all sorts of pastries. You can also enjoy high-quality complete meals, in a friendly woody décor.

item.title: Côte d'Or
item.body: Opened to celebrate 125 years of this famous Belgian chocolate, the boutique offers exclusive pralines with surprising ingredients and fl avours (try pine kernel, olive oil and rosemary).

item.title: Charlotte aux Pommes
item.body: Exclusively feminine shopping, and chic too. You?ll discover a selection of models from Jean-Paul Gaultier, Issey Miyake, Jil Sander, Prada, and others.

item.title: Diane von Fürstenberg
item.body: Remember Diane? Of course you do; she invented the famous wrap-dress! In her boutique, you will find a wide selection of dresses and accessories.

item.title: Elvis Pompilio
item.body:
After studies in graphical arts Elvis Pompilio designed his first hat creations becoming well known in the fashion world. In 1987 he began to work on his own and opened his first boutique in Brussels followed by a second one in Antwerp and later in Paris and London.
He has been working with many designers like Louis Féraud, Chanel, Thierry Mugler (all of them for Haute Couture) and also with others like Céline, Hugo Boss, Anteprima, Dirk Bikkembergs?
Some of his creations are part of the permanent collections of the Musée des Arts Décoratifs in France and of the Musée Grévin in Paris.
Elvis Pompilio himself receive the clientele. His creations are exclusively available in that boutique.

item.title: Flamant Store
item.body: A benchmark in home decoration and very up-market, very chic.

item.title: Costermans
item.body:
Our House offers a wide choice of furniture, firemantles, chandeliers, paintings and decorative arts, mostly european from the 18th and 19th centuries. Our workshops produce following the rules of craftsmanship luminaries: Sconces, lanterns; and ironworks, mainly copied from antique originals.
To equip your fireplace you will also find here a unique selection of cast iron backplates, but also antique and modern accessories for the fire.

item.title: Yellow Korner
item.body: YellowKorner proposes that you acquire a quality art photograph from 25?. Each photograph has a limited and numbered amount of copies printed, accompagnied by the artist's biography and an authenticity certificate guaranteeing its work of art status. More than 200 professional photographers have agreed for YellowKorner, to incrase the number of prints of their works, for a sample of their work, in order to be able you accessible prices.

item.title: Tout l'Or du Monde
item.body: This fully fair trade grocery-café offers a wide selection of top-notch organic or traditionally made produce. It?s a friendly place infused with cultures of the world, where you can drop in to buy your groceries, enjoy a drink or savour the seasonal wares of the organic and fair trade restaurant.

item.title: L'Epicerie Fine de la Senne
item.body: This refined grocer's shop offers you a delicious, healthy and fresh menu: the home-made soups, quiches, panini or lasagne make a perfect lunch in a one of the most pleasant spots.

item.title: La Maison du Thé
item.body:
Settled in 1897, it is one of first tea counters in Belgium.
More than 200 varieties of the whole world.

item.title: Le Palais des Thés
item.address: Place de la Vieille Halle aux Blés 45/Oud Korenhuis 45

item.title: Chez Ramon & Valy
item.body: Quality garments of all eras and styles.

item.title: Privejoke
item.body: Privejoke is an original boutique and a funky choice. This store offers a selection of the most trendy scandinavian and french brands of the moment for men et Women, such as Filippa K, Paul&Joe, Athé by Vanessa Bruno, Sessùn... and many others accessories.

item.title: Liquidoma Stock Americain
item.body: Liquidoma exists since the beginning of the years 1950 and proposes a broad product range soldiers, but also of the articles western, camp-site & trekking, of the sportwear, the working clotheses in various marks of international repute.

item.title: Conni Kaminski
item.body: Conni Kaminski?s boutique is very appreciated for her draping technique and her asymmetrical cuts. Her creations are beautiful from all angles and result in a feminine collection that is both simple and sophisticated.

item.title: Alizari
item.body: Ethnic inspired clothes designed in the store. Alizari has been made popular by its audacity and the fabrics' quality.

item.title: Le Paradis de la Babouche
item.body: The greatest specialist in slippers since 1908.

item.title: Taratata
item.body: This little store offers a very attractive selection of trendy and original quality shoes: Camper, Trippen, Loint's... Don't miss it!

item.title: Fresh Kicks
item.body: Maybe the best streetwear sneakers shop in Brussels. You'll find a unique collection that is very often refreshed. The principal brands include Nike, Adidas, New Balance...

item.title: Courrier Sud
item.body: A small boutique full of fancifuls jewels and trinkets from the whole world.

item.title: Emery & Cie
item.body: Decorating shop, craftsman tiles, paint, fabrics, wrought iron furniture. More than just a decoration shop, it is a source of inspiration for your interior ? as you stroll through the rooms of a superb house decorated by architect Agnès Emery.

item.title: Chine W-Sand Congo
item.body: Primitive african and asian art.

item.title: Taptoe - Galerie & Atelier
item.address: Place de la Vieille Halle aux Blés 26/Oud Korenhuis 26

item.title: Palais des Cotillons
item.body: More than a great joke, trick and costume shop, the Palais is an institution. Every local has been there, and more than once!

item.title: Teinturier De Geest
item.body:
Dry-cleaning of clothes and furnishing in fabric and leather.
Belgian Royal Warrant Holders.

item.title: Charli
item.body: Original and authentic bread and pastry shop.

item.title: De Noordzee ? La Mer du Nord
item.body: The place more run to buy and enjoy fish which is in the middle of Brussels and is called "La Mer du Nord". More than one fish shop it is a temple of tasting or ?the Brussels whole? is pressed at midday to regale delicious in-case with fish accompanied by small wine glass.

item.title: Champigros
item.body: Champignonnist, wholesale mushrooms.

item.title: Frederic Blondeel
item.body: This Belgian chocolate maker in the centre of town prepares cakes, biscuits, pralines and ice-cream with special house flavours that you can eat on the premises in his friendly tea room (or to go).

item.title: Viva M'Boma
item.body: Caterer of Brussels specialities.

item.title: Hüsniye Kardas
item.body: Stylist Hüsniye Kardas plays with genres, decomposing masculine and feminine fashion. Her style mixes elegance and eccentrity through playful metamorphoses. Her mission? To free clothes from their diktats.

item.title: Azniv Afsar
item.body: Originally from Armenia, this (lady) creator has developed some very original clothing collections since 1997, in a refined, geometric style.

item.title: La maison de la casquette
item.body: If you want to take back an original souvenir from Brussels, why not go for a quill pen? Very special.

item.title: Oxfam Vintage
item.body: Clothing, computers, books, pieces of furniture,? You will find d' office your happiness in one of our 42 stores. Moreover, your purchase will enable us to finance our activities in North and the South.

item.title: Desmecht
item.body: Herbalist's shop and dietetics. A great family of most remarkable plants.

item.title: Comus & Gasterea
item.body: With over 480 flavours on offer, this ice-cream maker produces all his ice cream by hand, from the purchase of ingredients to working out the recipe.

item.title: Café Costume
item.body: How can you have your own suit made to measure without paying a fortune? It?s totally possible from now, in this new concept where the customer can choose his suit ?à la carte?. By appontment only

item.title: AM Sweet
item.body: Teasaloon with a heartwarming and soft atmosphere. A.M. Sweet is the perfect place to have a rest and see time glide by.

item.title: Lady Agathe
item.body: This exclusive leathershop proposes creations of young talentuous designers such as Masha Keja, by toan, Buba, Cheet? all standing out for their remarkable use of colours and fabrics. To be followed closely, the first arrivals of the Lady Agathe line, only available here.

item.title: Apdm - Au pays des merveilles
item.body: Bagels, kitchen scale, on or off site catering service, surprise package bagel, breakfast, snack, brunch, deli, morning newspapers, wi-fi, bookcrossing, exhibitions, openings ...

item.title: Sacha Shoes
item.body: This original store seduces with its ?trendy-chic? collections. Lacquer pumps, silvery ballerinas, lowboots in coloured leather or trendy sneakers? Take your pick!

item.title: Mephisto
item.body: For a confortable and effortless walking experience

item.title: Nicolas
item.body: Distributor specialising in wine, champagne and spirits

item.title: Kings and Queens
item.body: Kings and Queens is an hairdressing salon.

item.title: Monsieur K
item.body: Beauty institute

item.title: Leatherneck
item.body: Or when uniforms become street wear? An original wardrobe of clothing designed or inspired by various armies.

item.title: Darakan
item.body: small city centre bookshop, all the latest thrillers and gay literature, as well as many works about the cinema, photography and rock music

item.title: Librairie The Skull
item.body: Founded in 1970. Dedications four times a month, exhibitions, manga, bookplates, silkscreens.

item.title: Le Dépôt
item.body: The whole world of strip cartoons.

item.title: Le Dépôt
item.body: Comics and news or second hand silkscreens, DVD's, action figures, ...

item.title: Comic Strip House
item.body: Celebrating the greatest masters of the Belgian school of comic strip (Marcinelle), this place puts on permanent and temporary exhibitions of famous comic strip heroes. Meet Gaston, Spirou, Lucky Luke, the Smurfs and many others, who all emerged from the pen of the greatest Belgian cartoonists.

item.title: Le Village de la Bande Dessinée
